repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  Unsetting global variables earlier in #28578 to avoid
          recursiveness, caused superfluous or even unlimited
          showmode().
Solution: Partly revert #28578 so that the globals are unset at the end
          of showmode(), and avoid recursiveness for ext UI by adding a
          recursive function guard to each generated UI call that may
          call a Lua callback.

Fix #29086

comment_data.body: I proposed this once before to @bfredl but got no response then, leaving it here for you to review. I think it is more sustainable than adding recursion guards manually where needed and still avoids the problem(only present for Lua callbacks so only adding it here).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -128,8 +128,16 @@ for i = 1, #events do
     write_signature(call_output, ev, '')
     call_output:write('\n{\n')
     if ev.remote_only then
+      -- Lua callbacks may emit other events or the same event again. Avoid the latter
+      -- by adding a recursion guard to each generated function that may call a Lua callback.

comment_data.body:
later on, I think we want recursiveness checks to be more semantic, like at least based on the category of events (like any ext_cmdline event handler shouldn't case another ext_cmdline event), but we can iterate on that during the 0.11 cycle. 

This would be okay for now.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -128,8 +128,16 @@ for i = 1, #events do
     write_signature(call_output, ev, '')
     call_output:write('\n{\n')
     if ev.remote_only then
+      -- Lua callbacks may emit other events or the same event again. Avoid the latter
+      -- by adding a recursion guard to each generated function that may call a Lua callback.

comment_regular_data.body: Is it possible to add a test?

> Is it possible to add a test?

Looking into it. I think there are more requirements than just `ext_popupmenu = true`, i.e. this already passes on master:

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/ui/popupmenu_spec.lua b/test/functional/ui/popupmenu_spec.lua
index 8f8604eecb..33a48374c1 100644
--- a/test/functional/ui/popupmenu_spec.lua
+++ b/test/functional/ui/popupmenu_spec.lua
@@ -911,6 +911,30 @@ describe('ui/ext_popupmenu', function()
                                                                   |
     ]])
   end)
+
+  it('does not result in recursive showmode()', function()
+    local cursor = 0
+    local screen_cursor = screen._handle_grid_cursor_goto
+    screen._handle_grid_cursor_goto = function(...)
+      screen_cursor(...)
+      cursor = cursor + 1
+    end
+    insert([[foo bar  ]])
+    feed('i<C-N>')
+    screen:expect({
+      grid = [[
+        foo bar foo^                                                 |
+        {1:~                                                           }|*6
+        {2:-- Keyword completion (^N^P) }{5:match 1 of 2}                   |
+      ]], popupmenu={
+      anchor = { 1, 0, 8 },
+      items = { { "foo", "", "", "" }, { "bar", "", "", "" } },
+      pos = 0
+    }
+    })
+    vim.uv.sleep(1000)
+    eq(cursor < 10, true)
+  end)
 end)

 describe("builtin popupmenu 'pumblend'", function()
```
Yeah idk. It's easy to reproduce unnecessary showmodes on master but I'm not sure how the infinite state loop is entered in the gnvim repro.

> It's easy to reproduce unnecessary showmodes on master but I'm not sure how the infinite state loop is entered in the gnvim repro.

Added a test that at least tests the former.

> It's easy to reproduce unnecessary showmodes on master but I'm not sure how the infinite state loop is entered in the gnvim repro.

The input is pretty much just this:
```
ifoobar<CR>foofoo<CR>foo<C-n>
```

What needs to happen is for the popumenu to open for completion. That input puts `foobar` and `foofoo` to the buffer, and then starts the completion from `foo` which triggers the completion for bot `foobar` and `foofoo`.

All this requires for `ext_popupmenu` to be enabled.

> All this requires for `ext_popupmenu` to be enabled.

Not true in my testing, I was talking about adding a test that fails on master. I was able to reproduce the issue in gnvim but not in our test environment.

I tested with the latest master, and the issue exists there too (not just for v0.10.0).

This PR fixes the issue.

> Not true in my testing, I was talking about adding a test that fails on master. I was able to reproduce the issue in gnvim but not in our test environment.

Are you able to reproduce the issue with `ext_popupmenu` disabled?

_edit: ext_popupmenu, not ext_messages_
Well no not the exact issue you described in #29086. But the underlying cause is not related to ext_popupmenu and can be tested for without it like in the added test in this PR.

title: fix(ui): superfluous showmode due to unset globals
